concise_definition: n. 絨毛, 無意義的內容; v. 搞砸, 說錯台詞

definitions.explanation_en: Soft, light, and fluffy material, such as the fine fibers from plants or the lint that accumulates in clothing dryers.
definitions.explanation_cn: 柔软、轻盈、蓬松的物质，如植物的细纤维或衣物烘干机中积聚的绒毛。
definitions.example_en: The cat left a trail of fluff on the black sofa.
definitions.example_cn: 猫在黑色沙发上留下了一串绒毛。

definitions.explanation_en: Content that is trivial, insubstantial, or lacking in serious value, often used to describe sensationalist journalism, empty dialogue, or superficial entertainment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指琐碎、空洞、缺乏实质价值的内容，常用于形容煽情的新闻、空洞的对话或肤浅的娱乐。
definitions.example_en: The movie was pure fluff—no plot, no depth, just pretty costumes and catchy music.
definitions.example_cn: 这部电影纯粹是垃圾内容——没有剧情，没有深度，只有漂亮的服装和朗朗上口的音乐。

definitions.explanation_en: To make a mistake, especially in speech or performance, such as forgetting lines or mispronouncing words during a presentation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在说话或表演中犯错，例如在演讲中忘记台词或发音错误。
definitions.example_en: He fluffed his opening line and had to start the speech over.
definitions.example_cn: 他开场白说错了，只好重新开始演讲。

definitions.explanation_en: To add fluff or padding to something, especially to make it appear longer or more impressive than it really is.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某事物中添加无实质意义的内容，以使其显得更长或更令人印象深刻。
definitions.example_en: The report was fluffed up with unnecessary statistics to make it look more thorough.
definitions.example_cn: 这份报告通过添加不必要的统计数据来夸大其详。

comparison.analysis: “Fluff” 作为名词时，与 “fuzz”（短毛、绒毛）相近，但 “fuzz” 更常用于描述头发或表面的细小毛发，而 “fluff” 更强调蓬松、轻盈的质感，也常用于比喻性语境。
“Nonsense”（胡言乱语）指完全无意义或荒谬的内容，语气更强烈、更具批判性；而 “fluff” 虽然也指空洞内容，但语气较轻，有时甚至带有轻松、无害的意味，如流行娱乐作品。
“Botch”（搞砸）强调因粗心或能力不足而导致的失败，通常带有负面评价；而 “fluff” 作为动词时，多指临时性的口误或小失误，不一定是能力问题，常用于表演或演讲场合，语气相对温和。
